member.name: MF_TOPOSTATUS
member.summary: Specifies the status of a topology during playback.

member.name: MF_TOPOSTATUS.MF_TOPOSTATUS_READY
member.summary: The topology is ready to start. After this status flag is received, you can use the Media Session's method to query the topology for services, such as rate control.

member.name: MF_TOPOSTATUS.MF_TOPOSTATUS_STARTED_SOURCE
member.summary: The Media Session has started to read data from the media sources in the topology.

member.name: MF_TOPOSTATUS.MF_TOPOSTATUS_DYNAMIC_CHANGED
member.summary: The Media Session modified the topology, because the format of a stream changed.

member.name: MF_TOPOSTATUS.MF_TOPOSTATUS_SINK_SWITCHED
member.summary: The media sinks have switched from the previous topology to this topology. This status value is not sent for the first topology that is played. For the first topology, the MESessionStarted event indicates that the media sinks have started receiving data.

member.name: MF_TOPOSTATUS.MF_TOPOSTATUS_ENDED
member.summary: Playback of this topology is complete. The Media Session might still use the topology internally. The Media Session does not completely release the topology until it sends the next MF_TOPOSTATUS_STARTED_SOURCE status event or the MESessionEnded event.
